# composite

**Type Property**

An attribute that derives its value by composing other attributes.

## Declaration

```swift
static let composite: NSAttributeDescription.AttributeType
```

## Discussion

Composite attributes support all attribute types except the following:

- [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeDescription/AttributeType-swift.struct/undefined]
- [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeDescription/AttributeType-swift.struct/objectID]
- [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeDescription/AttributeType-swift.struct/binaryData] (when [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSAttributeDescription/allowsExternalBinaryDataStorage] is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true])

For more information, see [doc://com.apple.coredata/documentation/CoreData/NSCompositeAttributeDescription].

## Attribute Types

- **binaryData**: An attribute that stores binary data.
- **boolean**: An attribute that stores a Boolean value.
- **date**: An attribute that stores a date.
- **decimal**: An attribute that stores a decimal value.
- **double**: An attribute that stores a double value.
- **float**: An attribute that stores a float value.
- **integer16**: An attribute that stores a 16-bit signed integer value.
- **integer32**: An attribute that stores a 32-bit signed integer value.
- **integer64**: An attribute that stores a 64-bit signed integer value.
- **objectID**: An attribute that stores a managed object’s ID.
- **string**: An attribute that stores a string.
- **transformable**: An attribute that uses a value transformer to derive its value.
- **undefined**: An attribute that doesn’t have an explicit type.
- **uri**: An attribute that stores a uniform resource identifier.
- **uuid**: An attribute that stores a universally unique identifier.
